text.p: These are the main stories in Latvian newspapers on Thursday. Prepared for Reuters by the Co-operation Fund. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy:
- President Ulmanis is continuing his visit to Denmark. He spoke about business prospects in Latvia at a seminar organised by the Danish chamber of commerce.

- The head of the foreign ministry consular department informed journalists about the prospects of introducing non-visa travelling between Latvia and the Nordic countries. She said that the main precondition for abolishing visa regulations is to conclude agreements on the re-admission of illegal immigrants.
- Today and tomorrow in Riga delegations of Latvia and Russia will continue talks on the delimitation of the border between the two countries.
- Prime Minister Andris Shkele calls demands for subsidies and tax reductions, put forward by farmers from the Vidzeme region, as madness.
- The World Bank's executive director, Ruta Jakobi, spoke positively about reforms in Latvia at a meeting with deputy parliament speaker Andris Ameriks.
- The salaries of cabinet members are due to be increased by an average 1.5 times from March 1, according to unofficial information.
- The draft plan for Baltic customs union is to be submitted for consideration by the cabinet.
